text:
I have a bit of an emergency. None of my design manager serverless functions are able to be updated. They say they're getting updated but when I hit the endpoint it's the same
Are you no longer able to publish updates through the design manager functions, you need to make all your functions through projects?
That shouldn’t be the case. Do you hit any error?
There's also this stage button that does nothing
So what happens when you run them?
They run but they don't run the updated code
Literally just deleted all my code and clicked publish and then requested the function and it return the pervious code
A lot of customers use design manager functions for critical operations (like me and my companies)
This issue affects all 3 portals I've tested on. I've used different configs for them as well. Node version 14, 16 and 18
Also it affects portals that don't have CRM development on them
Changes are now being reflected on accounts that don't have CRM developments installed on them (only tested on 1 USA based account)
Hi Carter. Thanks for flagging this issue. Our developers are investigating the cause right now.

Hi Carter. Thanks for the patience. We found out what is going on. Because your portal is ungated to the serverless packages beta, you will need to complete the following steps to publish your changes:

1. update the serverless function definition in DM
2. click the “publish changes” button
3. right-click the folder and click “deploy all functions”
Another option is to make the desired changes from the CLI. We realize that this is not intuitive and will evaluate solutions for developers working in the design manager.
Nice! really glad to get that fixed!
But also I had the same issue on an account that wasn't in the beta (it was the account that was also not in the CRM dev beta)

The non dependencies beta portal is now working though as of 2 hours ago (<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04A3FUK8HK/p1673465054108899?thread_ts=1673461560.193459&cid=C04A3FUK8HK|link>) so don't really know what was going on there
